Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0872, 0.0]. Now, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 1. First, create line 1 with a Start Point at [0.0, 0.0] and an End Point at [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Next, create line 2 with a Start Point at [0.75, 0.0] and an End Point at [0.75, 0.2382]. 3. Then, create line 3 with a Start Point at [0.75, 0.2382] and an End Point at [0.0, 0.2382]. 4. Lastly, create line 4 with a Start Point at [0.0, 0.2382] and an End Point at [0.0, 0.0]. loop\\_1 is formed by line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4, closing the loop. face\\_1 is created with loop\\_1. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale, which is set to 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch to a 3D Sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with an extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal of 0.0872, generating the 3D model. The final part has a length of 0.75, a width of 0.0872, and a height of 0.75. With these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to generate the parametric CAD model of the first part. For the final shape and any additional parts, follow the same process using the information provided in the CAD Assembly JSON. Remember to swap part\\_1, coordinate system, sketch, and extrusion data with any new information for other parts, and adjust headings accordingly. Do not use specific boolean operation termsâ€”instead, use their natural language descriptions to accurately convey the intended operations. By providing clear, concise, and organized instruction, the junior CAD designer can generate an accurate CAD model, which will aid greatly in the assembly process or manufacturing compared to manual methods.</description>
